item.title: Vectorizing R code
item.author: robbertjan-1994@hotmail.com (Robbert-Jan 't Hoen)
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. When you click the Knit button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min.

item.title: First blog post
item.author: robbertjan-1994@hotmail.com (Robbert-Jan 't Hoen)
item.description: And let there be ligth! After a few days of troubleshooting, I have finally succeeded in launching my first website with Hugo, hurray! I will start this website off by giving a brief overview of my current setup and stating my intentions for the shorter-term. Website setup My current setup is GitHub Pages + Hugo + Blogdown as recommended in this excellent tutorial by Amber Thomas. This allows me to create rich web content by utilizing Rmarkdown files with the blogdown package in Rstudio.

item.title: About
item.author: robbertjan-1994@hotmail.com (Robbert-Jan 't Hoen)
item.description: Getting to know me I am Robbert-Jan â€™t Hoen, a 22 year old student living in the neighbourhood of Rotterdam, the Netherlands. I hold a bachelor in Econometrics and Operations Research, and am currently pursuing a master in Quantitative Finance. My interests are mainly concerned with mathematics, statistics, machine learning, renewable energy, healthcare, new technologies, and almost all sports. Purpose of the website My motivation for building this website is threefold:
